title: Child Abuse Unit Charge Man For Shooting Gun While Playing A Video Game
content:
(Harris County, TX) Investigators with the Harris County Sheriff’s Office Child Abuse Unit has arrested and charged a 21 year old man for reckless injury to a child after he fired a handgun in his home while playing a video game on Saturday, September 16, 2016 at 2:45 pm in northwest Harris County.
Investigators say that Kevin Castillo was playing a video game in his room, when he pointed a handgun and pulling the trigger on what he thought was an unloaded pistol.
When Castillo pulled the trigger the handgun discharged into the television and through an adjoining wall an struck his 13 year old sister who was sitting on a bed.
Family members rushed to the girl’s aid, pressing towels to the wound behind her right ear.
An ambulance transported her by ground to Memorial Hermann Medical Center where she was in good condition.
Castillo claims he pulled the magazine from the handgun, but in this incident he failed to remove the round chambered in the barrel.
He was released after posting a $30,000 bond and his first court appearance is December 02, 2016 in the 230th felony court.
